intro: Nonea perezii, commonly known as the Peruvian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Nonea perezii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical gardens.
